page.title: 11Morris dancing team
page.content: Our team consists of eight girls and three musicians on drums and tambours. The dances are easy to pick up so anyone can learn. We do swings, back to backs,hays, stick clashes, stars and some other complicated steps. we are learning a new dance to the tune of 'House of Dinah',which was collected by Cecil Sharpe in Broseley in the early years of the century. We know three other dances called 'Woodhouse Bog''Wenlock' and'Benthall' (the last two are local places).We have danced at local fetes, a music festival and at another school, they gave us Â£5 for school funds. We practise at lunchtime at school, sometimes in the school hall, sometimes on the field.
